åŸæ–‡: PyCoder's Weekly - Issue #377

  • ç”¨ Collaborative Filtering æ„å»ºæ¨èå¼•æ“
    • REAL PYTHON

In this tutorial, youâ€™ll learn about collaborative filtering, which is one of the most common approaches for building recommender systems. Youâ€™ll cover the various types of algorithms that fall under this category and see how to implement them in Python.

â€œEveryone in the Python community has heard about Celery at least once, and maybe even already worked with it. Basically, itâ€™s a handy tool that helps run postponed or dedicated code in a separate process or even on a separate computer or server. This saves time and effort on many levels.â€

In this course, youâ€™ll see how you can make your loops more Pythonic if youâ€™re coming to Python from a C-style language. Youâ€™ll learn how you can get the most out of using range(), xrange(), and enumerate(). Youâ€™ll also see how you can avoid having to keep track of loop indexes manually.

  • bistring: Python Library for Non-Destructive Text Processing
    • GITHUB.COM/MICROSOFT

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

>>> from bistring import bistr
>>> s = bistr('ğ•¿ğ–ğ–Š ğ––ğ–šğ–ğ–ˆğ–, ğ–‡ğ–—ğ–”ğ–œğ–“ ğŸ¦Š ğ–ğ–šğ–’ğ–•ğ–˜ ğ–”ğ–›ğ–Šğ–— ğ–™ğ–ğ–Š ğ–‘ğ–†ğ–Ÿğ– ğŸ¶')
>>> s = s.normalize('NFKD')     # Unicode normalization
>>> s = s.casefold()            # Case-insensitivity
>>> s = s.replace('ğŸ¦Š', 'fox')  # Replace emoji with text
>>> s = s.replace('ğŸ¶', 'dog')
>>> s = s.sub(r'[^\w\s]+', '')  # Strip everything but letters and spaces
>>> s = s[:19]                  # Extract a substring
>>> s.modified                  # The modified substring, after changes
'the quick brown fox'
>>> s.original                  # The original substring, before changes
'ğ•¿ğ–ğ–Š ğ––ğ–šğ–ğ–ˆğ–, ğ–‡ğ–—ğ–”ğ–œğ–“ ğŸ¦Š'
